intro: Paraixeris sonchifolia, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its leaves are usually lobed and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
